document_data.name: Ruff
document_data.mainbody: A '''ruff''' or '''ruffled collar''' was a tight form of neckwear that encircled the entirety of the neck. It was typically worn by the upperclass and aristocracy, but conversely held in disdain by many [[adventurer]]s and lower class.
document_data.Availability:
* [[Chalasse's Fine Clothing]] in [[Immersea]] sold ruffs.
* Skilled crafters in the village of [[Gladehap]] were known to create ruffs from time to time.

Notable Wearers.Classes: * [[Thieves]] sometimes wore ruffs for the purpose of disguising themselves as upperclass folk, allowing them to easily find entry into high society functions.
Notable Wearers.Individuals:
* [[Marek Rymüt]], a Thayan raised in a wealthy household in [[Nethjet]], sometimes wore ruffs in his youth.
* [[Tril (half-elf)|Tril]], a [[half-elf]] in [[south Faerûn]], wore a ruff alongside his [[velvet]] [[doublet]].<ref>
Notable Wearers.Regions, Nations, and Settlements:
* In [[interior Faerûn]], the ruff was worn by some in the nations of [[Cormyr]] and [[Sembia]].
* In the [[Unapproachable East]], the ruff was worn by some upperclass in [[Thay]].
